text: when Roanoke Governor John White returns
from a voyage to England in 1590 he
discovers that his entire colony has
gone missing the colony had always
planned to move further inland but they
were supposed to wait for white or at
least leave a clear message of where
they had gone if they did decide to
leave so is this stone uncovered
hundreds of years later the missing
message to John White
this stone is signed with the initials
ewd Eleanor White their governor white
was the first governor
Eleanor White there was his daughter
according to the stone an Indian attack
slaughtered many including her husband
and Aeneas and her baby daughter
Virginia this stone purports that there
was a burial of all of those folks who
were were slaughtered and that at the
site of the burial there is a second
stone that then president of Brunel
University dr. Pierce he began the
search for the second stone
dr. Pierce offered a $500 reward and he
was not disappointed over the next year
he received a further 47 carved stones
seeming to continue Eleanor's story but
experts were not convinced this is an
example of the 47 stones and you can see
the difference you can actually see burn
marks from drills so it's they're really
quite obviously carved in with a
rotating device we have probably drill
press the marks on the lettering plus
the fact that the language is just not
quite right for the era suggests that
these or at least that's what the
experts believe are forgeries in 1941
the Dare stones were dismissed as an
elaborate hoax but dr. Schrader now
thinks they were too quick to discount
the first stone this stone is different
and our effort is to prove that this is
a legitimate stone we are collaborating
with 16th century graffiti experts who
are looking at the actual grammar
because they very precisely can date a
text based on the placement of words the
preliminary work has discovered sentence
structure that is peculiar to the mid
[Music]
